ids_info.name: radiation
ids_info.description: Radiation emitted by the plasma and neutrals

radiation/vacuum_toroidal_field.documentation: Characteristics of the vacuum toroidal field (used in rho_tor definition)

radiation/vacuum_toroidal_field/r0.documentation: Reference major radius where the vacuum toroidal magnetic field is given (usually a fixed position such as the middle of the vessel at the equatorial midplane)

radiation/vacuum_toroidal_field/b0.documentation: Vacuum toroidal field at R0 [T]; Positive sign means anti-clockwise when viewing from above. The product R0B0 must be consistent with the b_tor_vacuum_r field of the tf IDS.

radiation/grid_ggd/identifier/index.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

radiation/grid_ggd/path.documentation: Path of the grid, including the IDS name, in case of implicit reference to a grid_ggd node described in another IDS. To be filled only if the grid is not described explicitly in this grid_ggd structure. Example syntax: #wall:2/description_ggd(1)/grid_ggd, means that the grid is located in the wall IDS, occurrence 2, with relative path description_ggd(1)/grid_ggd, using Fortran index convention (here : first index of the array)

radiation/grid_ggd/space/identifier/inde.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

radiation/grid_ggd/space/geometry_type.documentation: Type of space geometry (0: standard, 1:Fourier, >1: Fourier with periodicity)

radiation/grid_ggd/space/geometry_type/i.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

radiation/grid_ggd/space/coordinates_typ.documentation: Type of coordinates describing the physical space, for every coordinate of the space. The size of this node therefore defines the dimension of the space.
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

radiation/grid_ggd/space/objects_per_dim.documentation: Definition of the space objects for every dimension (from one to the dimension of the highest-dimensional objects). The index correspond to 1=nodes, 2=edges, 3=faces, 4=cells/volumes, .... For every index, a collection of objects of that dimension is described.
Set of objects for a given dimension
Set of  (n-1)-dimensional objects defining the boundary of this n-dimensional object
List of indices of the n-dimensional objects adjacent to the given n-dimensional object. An object can possibly have multiple neighbours on a boundary
Geometry data associated with the object, its detailed content is defined by ../../geometry_content. Its dimension depends on the type of object, geometry and coordinate considered.
List of nodes forming this object (indices to objects_per_dimension(1)%object(:) in Fortran notation)
Measure of the space object, i.e. physical size (length for 1d, area for 2d, volume for 3d objects,...)

2D geometry data associated with the object. Its dimension depends on the type of object, geometry and coordinate considered. Typically, the first dimension represents the object coordinates, while the second dimension would represent the values of the various degrees of freedom of the finite element attached to the object.
Content of the ../object/geometry node for this dimension
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

radiation/grid_ggd/grid_subset/identifie.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

radiation/grid_ggd/grid_subset/dimension.documentation: Space dimension of the grid subset elements, using the convention 1=nodes, 2=edges, 3=faces, 4=cells/volumes

radiation/grid_ggd/grid_subset/element.documentation: Set of elements defining the grid subset. An element is defined by a combination of objects from potentially all spaces

radiation/grid_ggd/grid_subset/element/o.documentation: Set of objects defining the element
Index of the space from which that object is taken
Dimension of the object - using the convention  1=nodes, 2=edges, 3=faces, 4=cells/volumes

radiation/grid_ggd/grid_subset/base.documentation: Set of bases for the grid subset. For each base, the structure describes the projection of the base vectors on the canonical frame of the grid.

radiation/grid_ggd/grid_subset/base/tens.documentation: Covariant metric tensor, given on each element of the subgrid (first dimension)
Contravariant metric tensor, given on each element of the subgrid (first dimension)

radiation/grid_ggd/grid_subset/metric.documentation: Metric of the canonical frame onto Cartesian coordinates

radiation/grid_ggd/grid_subset/metric/te.documentation: Covariant metric tensor, given on each element of the subgrid (first dimension)
Contravariant metric tensor, given on each element of the subgrid (first dimension)

radiation/process.documentation: Set of emission processes. The radiation characteristics are described at the level of the originating entity. For instance describe line radiation from neutrals under profiles_1d/neutral. Line and recombination radiation under profiles_1d/ion. Bremsstrahlung radiation under profiles_1d/neutral and ion ...

radiation/process/identifier/index.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

radiation/process/global_quantities/insi.documentation: Emissions from the core plasma, inside the last closed flux surface
Total power emitted by all species
Total power emitted by all ion species
Total power emitted by all neutral species
Total emissions inside the vacuum vessel
Total power emitted by all species
Total power emitted by all ion species
Total power emitted by all neutral species

radiation/process/profiles_1d.documentation: Emissivity radial profiles for various time slices

radiation/process/profiles_1d/grid/rho_t.documentation: Normalized toroidal flux coordinate. The normalizing value for rho_tor_norm, is the toroidal flux coordinate at the equilibrium boundary (LCFS or 99.x % of the LCFS in case of a fixed boundary equilibium calculation, see time_slice/boundary/b_flux_pol_norm in the equilibrium IDS)
Toroidal flux coordinate = sqrt(phi/(pi*b0)), where the toroidal magnetic field, b0, corresponds to that stored in vacuum_toroidal_field/b0 and pi can be found in the IMAS constants

radiation/process/profiles_1d/grid/psi.documentation: Poloidal magnetic flux. Integral of magnetic field passing through a contour defined by the intersection of a flux surface passing through the point of interest and a Z=constant plane. If the integration surface is flat, the surface normal vector is in the increasing vertical coordinate direction, Z, namely upwards.

radiation/process/profiles_1d/grid/volum.documentation: Volume enclosed inside the magnetic surface

radiation/process/profiles_1d/grid/area.documentation: Cross-sectional area of the flux surface

radiation/process/profiles_1d/grid/surfa.documentation: Surface area of the toroidal flux surface

radiation/process/profiles_1d/grid/psi_m.documentation: Value of the poloidal magnetic flux at the magnetic axis (useful to normalize the psi array values when the radial grid doesn't go from the magnetic axis to the plasma boundary)

radiation/process/profiles_1d/grid/psi_b.documentation: Value of the poloidal magnetic flux at the plasma boundary (useful to normalize the psi array values when the radial grid doesn't go from the magnetic axis to the plasma boundary)

radiation/process/profiles_1d/electrons/.documentation: Radiated power from inside the flux surface (volume integral of the emissivity inside the flux surface)

radiation/process/profiles_1d/power_insi.documentation: Total power from ion species (summed over ion  species) inside the flux surface (volume integral of the emissivity inside the flux surface)
Total power from ion species (summed over neutral species) inside the flux surface (volume integral of the emissivity inside the flux surface)

radiation/process/profiles_1d/ion.documentation: Process terms related to the different ion species

radiation/process/profiles_1d/ion/elemen.documentation: List of elements forming the atom or molecule
Number of atoms of this element in the molecule

radiation/process/profiles_1d/ion/z_ion.documentation: Ion charge (of the dominant ionization state; lumped ions are allowed)

radiation/process/profiles_1d/ion/name.documentation: String identifying ion (e.g. H+, D+, T+, He+2, C+, ...)

radiation/process/profiles_1d/ion/neutra.documentation: Index of the corresponding neutral species in the ../../neutral array

radiation/process/profiles_1d/ion/power_.documentation: Radiated power from inside the flux surface (volume integral of the emissivity inside the flux surface)

radiation/process/profiles_1d/ion/multip.documentation: Multiple states calculation flag : 0-Only one state is considered; 1-Multiple states are considered and are described in the state structure

radiation/process/profiles_1d/ion/state.documentation: Process terms related to the different charge states of the species (ionization, energy, excitation, ...)

radiation/process/profiles_1d/ion/state/.documentation: Minimum Z of the charge state bundle
Maximum Z of the charge state bundle
String identifying charge state (e.g. C+, C+2 , C+3, C+4, C+5, C+6, ...)
Vibrational mode of this state, e.g. "A_g". Need to define, or adopt a standard nomenclature.
Configuration of atomic orbitals of this state, e.g. 1s2-2s1
Radiated power from inside the flux surface (volume integral of the emissivity inside the flux surface)

radiation/process/profiles_1d/neutral.documentation: Process terms related to the different neutral species

radiation/process/profiles_1d/neutral/el.documentation: List of elements forming the atom or molecule
Number of atoms of this element in the molecule

radiation/process/profiles_1d/neutral/na.documentation: String identifying the neutral species (e.g. H, D, T, He, C, ...)

radiation/process/profiles_1d/neutral/io.documentation: Index of the corresponding ion species in the ../../ion array

radiation/process/profiles_1d/neutral/po.documentation: Radiated power from inside the flux surface (volume integral of the emissivity inside the flux surface)

radiation/process/profiles_1d/neutral/mu.documentation: Multiple states calculation flag : 0-Only one state is considered; 1-Multiple states are considered and are described in the state structure

radiation/process/profiles_1d/neutral/st.documentation: Process terms related to the different charge states of the species (energy, excitation, ...)
Vibrational mode of this state, e.g. "A_g". Need to define, or adopt a standard nomenclature.
Neutral type (if the considered state is a neutral), in terms of energy. ID =1: cold; 2: thermal; 3: fast; 4: NBI
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.
Configuration of atomic orbitals of this state, e.g. 1s2-2s1
Radiated power from inside the flux surface (volume integral of the emissivity inside the flux surface)
